Articles.Content:
Hi, I'm getting this exception when loading a save game:

Spoiler

[ERR 18:26:58.091] Exception loading ScenarioModule KerbalKonstructsSettings: System.NullReferenceException
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) UnityEngine.GameObject.GetComponentInChildren(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Type,bool)
  at UnityEngine.GameObject.GetComponentInChildren[T] (System.Boolean includeInactive) [0x00001] in <12e76cd50cc64cf19e759e981cb725af>:0
  at KerbalKonstructs.Modules.ConnectionManager.RemoveStockStations () [0x0004b] in <7dd8cd55479d4f5fa301c344b9c37231>:0
  at KerbalKonstructs.Modules.ConnectionManager.LoadGroundStations () [0x0002f] in <7dd8cd55479d4f5fa301c344b9c37231>:0
  at KerbalKonstructs.Career.KerbalKonstructsSettings.OnLoad (ConfigNode node) [0x000c2] in <7dd8cd55479d4f5fa301c344b9c37231>:0
  at ScenarioModule.Load (ConfigNode node) [0x0000e] in <cd473063d3a2482f8d93d388d0c95035>:0
  at ScenarioRunner.AddModule (ConfigNode node) [0x0005e] in <cd473063d3a2482f8d93d388d0c95035>:0

KSP 1.12.2. I'm using Galileo Planet Pack and a bunch of seemingly unrelated other mods. I can provide additional info if needed.

Is it possible to rebuild buildings destroyed? I may have nuked the harbor next to KSC

the ones from KK

On 8/6/2021 at 2:02 PM, Caerfinon said:

Support and discussion have moved to this thread. Please take your Kerbal Konstructs related posts there.

i use kk( v.1.8.3.0 ), Kerbin side remastered (1.0.1), Custom pre launch checks (1.8.1.1).

when just i install kk and cplc first, i can see window by press CTRL+K.

but realize didn't install kerbin side after make group - save and quit ksp and install that and relaunch ksp, i can't see window by press CTRL+K.

What Shall I DO?

ps.

This symptom occur KSP 1.12.2.3167 and 1.11.2.3077 BOTH.

i install stock 1.11.2.3077 as instruction (Forum Reply) , and install mods and do i wrote above.

On 10/6/2021 at 1:28 AM, Cindyrella said:

i use kk( v.1.8.3.0 ), Kerbin side remastered (1.0.1), Custom pre launch checks (1.8.1.1).

when just i install kk and cplc first, i can see window by press CTRL+K.

but realize didn't install kerbin side after make group - save and quit ksp and install that and relaunch ksp, i can't see window by press CTRL+K.

What Shall I DO?

ps.

This symptom occur KSP 1.12.2.3167 and 1.11.2.3077 BOTH.

i install stock 1.11.2.3077 as instruction (Forum Reply) , and install mods and do i wrote above.

get kerbal konstructs continued

how do i delete something that i accidentally placed?

and how do i leave the kk menu?

9 minutes ago, Fletch4 said:

how do i delete something that i accidentally placed?

and how do i leave the kk menu?

 

In the part placement menu the delete button often gets hidden below the screen edge, you need to drag the window up till you see it. Once you delete and leave that window you can ctrl K again to leave. There may be a cross top right corner for the main menu too. Been awhile and can't remember for sure.
thx
it is so broken

11 hours ago, Fletch4 said:

it is so broken
well, thank you. i feel like i should've noticed this.

Ah, I was wondering where my airports went to from 5 years ago. I think putting a link to KerbinSide would be good otherwise KK doesn't come with the airports and kampus to play with   

The KerbinSide threads are really old though.

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/160099-122-13-14-15-kerbin-side-continued-145-05112018/

Edit: There's a Remastered version. This seems newer. Time to test them out.
 

 

Edited November 8, 2021 by Goddess Bhavani

10 minutes ago, Goddess Bhavani said:

Ah, I was wondering where my airports went to from 5 years ago. I think putting a link to KerbinSide would be good otherwise KK doesn't come with the airports and kampus to play with   

The KerbinSide threads are really old though.

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/160099-122-13-14-15-kerbin-side-continued-145-05112018/

They still work - the format of the statics hasn't changed significantly since 1.5.x. So long as you're on the correct version of KK for your KSP version, Kerbin-side Complete Continued works just fine. (caveat, I haven't launched from *every* site, so there might still be some hidden issues with specific sites)
